intro: Burmeistera carnosa var. metastasia, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a tropical plant native to Mexico. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine, velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens.
